result.execSummary:
Richard Anthony Harp was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Richard Anthony Harp was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Anthony Harp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed by SRN & Def. this date. eif
Bail/bond hearing on April 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Richard Anthony Harp appeared from jail. Defendant has a felony warrant out of Martin County MN.  Defendant would like to waive extradition. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court questions Defendant.  SRN and Defendant signed. Defendant to be held without bail until pick up from Minnesota. ADA Nieskes states charges will not be filed from last week. Court vacates bond.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CO; TCH for HWC, RPR; Erin Drost, ADA Kevin Gehler, Atty Alex Andrea and Richard Harp appears from jail. Defendant has a warrant out of Martin County MN. Defendant is invoking his 5th amendment rights. Defendant is currently homeless. Court addresses bond.
